Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.input.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
InputHandler - Processes keyboard input and delegates to game logic. Single Responsibility: Convert keyboard input to game events. Uses Strategy Pattern: - Different key handlers can be implemented as strategies - Enables easy customization of key bindings - Separates input handling from game logic Responsibilities: - Map keyboard keys to game events - Create MoveEvent objects for each input - Delegate to InputEventListener for game logic processing - Support hold, hard drop, and other special moves

  • Method Details

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener listener)
      Sets the event listener that will process game events.
      Parameters:
      listener - The InputEventListener (typically GameController)

    • handleKeyPressed

      public void handleKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles keyboard key press events. Delegates game controls to InputEventListener and UI controls to UIEventListener.
      Parameters:
      event - The JavaFX KeyEvent

    • setUIEventListener

      public void setUIEventListener(InputHandler.UIEventListener listener)
      Sets a UI event listener for handling meta controls (pause, new game, etc). These are typically handled by the GuiController.
      Parameters:
      listener - The UIEventListener for UI actions

    • setKeyBindingStrategy

      public void setKeyBindingStrategy(InputHandler.KeyBindingStrategy strategy)
      Sets a custom key binding strategy. Strategy Pattern: Allows runtime customization of key bindings.
      Parameters:
      strategy - The custom KeyBindingStrategy implementation
